H0.text: All individuals develop traits to match changes to their environment is the statement that best describes the process of natural selection in a population.

H1.text: All individuals learn to adapt to specific changes that occur slowly in their environment is the statement that best describes the process of natural selection in a population.

H2.text: Some individuals respond to their environment by mutating to make themselves more likely to survive is the statement that best describes the process of natural selection in a population.

H3.text: Some individuals have genetic differences that make them more likely to survive and reproduce in their environment, which best describes the process of natural selection in a population.

A4.text: Some variations may improve an individual's chances of surviving and reproducing such that its lifetime reproductive rate is increased.

A5.text: variations which seem to us in our ignorance to arise spontaneously

A6.text: More individuals are produced each generation than can survive.

A7.text: Those individuals with heritable traits better suited to the environment will survive.
